column4: is there a way to stop ubuntu from asking for the cd everytime i try to apt-get something?
just put a # in front of the Cd line in the /etc/apt/sources.list, or disable it in synaptic
yeh i just did that, so gonna try it out
don't forget to reload / update :)
synaptic package manager :)
either find it in the menu, or start it from a terminal with ` sudo synaptic`
on warty it's under computer > system config
im using xfce4 and im also working with a server install
so i dont think synaptic is on here
I see - well sudo synaptic should start it
try it
if not, you can easily install it
says synaptic: command not found
yes, sudo apt-get install synaptic
thanks
this looks good!  will synaptic download everythign and install for me too, or is it a browser?
it will do all that  :)
it's the package manager
good stuff! thanks for the help! :D
no worries :)
